result.name: Chi Lin Vegetarian

reviews.text: This vegan restaurant is set amidst a charming Buddhist nunnery/garden, behind a manmade waterfall. Although slightly expensive the food is nicely prepared with fresh ingredients. Worth a visit especially considering the nice setting.
Fabulous food. Wonderful service. Friendly staff.
Very sweet and kind management. Knowledgeable of spirituality and the world at large. The teas are quite unique.
Lovely place, very friendly staff, food is very good
Very best veggie Chinese style catering

result.name: 龍門樓 - 志蓮素齋

reviews.text:
餐館位於南蓮園池內，環境十分清幽舒適。餐廳內的布置簡單典雅，而且有兩扇大窗，可看到公園外的人工瀑布，令人心曠神宜。
食物方面，用料新鮮講究，能看出精挑細選；而醬料與調味料亦指明使用優質的貨色。每道菜式都精緻好吃，調味恰宜，是素食的好選擇。除了餸菜外，餐廳供應的茶亦很好喝。
餐廳的菜式並不算便宜，但物有所值。要留意餐廳的每個時段都有最低消費要求，但並不難達到。人流亦算多，平日的午市時段亦會滿座。

This vegan restaurant is set amidst a charming Buddhist nunnery/garden, behind a manmade waterfall. Although slightly expensive the food is nicely prepared with fresh ingredients. Worth a visit especially considering the nice setting.
不錯既素食地方，幾有特色，味道亦不錯，連茶都幾好飲，，可惜無可樂果d..
齋菜好吃，环境不錯舒適，只是款式不多和价錢較貴.
Fabulous food. Wonderful service. Friendly staff.

result.vicinity: Nan Lian Garden, 龍門樓地下至二樓, 60號 Fung Tak Road, Diamond Hill

result.adr_address: Fung Tak Rd, Diamond Hill, Hong Kong
result.formatted_address: Fung Tak Rd, Diamond Hill, Hong Kong
result.name: 南蓮園池

reviews.text: Let’s try something totally different🏮🏮🏮. How about a nunnery. I was overwhelmed by the calmness and beauty of the gardens. Sculpted trees and gardens. The ancient architectural designs of the buildings take you back to a time of the days gone by. I left this beautiful place calm and recharged ⛩⛩⛩

One of the places we like to visit around Chinese New Year is he Nan Lian Gardens (free entry) at Diamond Hill. Opening hours 7am to 9pm daily. Along with visiting the adjacent Chi Lin Nunnery, this is one of my very favourite attractions in Hong Kong. 

Nan Lian is a landscaped Chinese garden which is always well manicured and maintained, creating a peaceful and tranquil environment which can be enjoyed year round. We particularly enjoy visiting during the early months when the weather is cooler, making it more pleasant to spend time outside, enjoying the attractions at Nan Lian Gardens. 

Here you will find a nice, paved walking trail which passes numerous trees, shrubs, bonzai, several artificial bodies of water, including a large koy fish pond (the fish are really big now), an island pavilion and pavilion bridge, a rockery and exhibition hall (HK$20 per person), snack shop, souvenir shop, ceremonial tea house and vegetarian restaurant. 

The entire grounds at Nan Lian are beautiful and photogenic. Plenty of places to take a seat and just enjoy yourself. It is a great place to relax, take it slow and unwind a bit in Hong Kong. 

You can make make a quick walk through in no more than 20-30 minutes if you are short on time or spend several hours making a combined visit with Chi Lin Nunnery connected by footbridge and by having lunch at the Chi Lin Vegetarian restaurant here at Nan Lian Gardens.
